You have become my husband. Therefore, out of the love I have for you and since I have the intention to make you inherit some immovable property, I have chosen love as a reward and have given you the immovable property as per the schedule below at a price of Rs. 8,60,000-00 (eight lakhs and sixty thousand rupees in words) and I have taken possession of the said property to you today itself.
From now on, you will be the permanent full right holder of this settlement property and you will be liable to pay the amount due to the Shri Panchayat Board You shall pay all taxes and enjoy the full rights of charity and sale for the entire period of your children and grandchildren. Whatever disputes arise regarding this settlement property, whether by anyone or by anyone, all of them shall be settled by me or by my own money and I shall be able to implement it without interruption to you or your relatives according to this settlement. The immovable property as per the schedule below has been the property of our ancestors and has come into my possession and I have been enjoying it with full possession and rights up to this day. The A.C.C.R.C.Shed with the residence as per the schedule below has not been alienated to anyone else. Having assured you that the property is undisputed, the survey number, letter, permit, boundaries and measurements are correct, this settlement deed is written and given in your name. This settlement property is hereby filed with the M. Notice for the purpose of registering it in your name in the accounts of the Panchayat. As per this deed, the property does not belong to Andhra Pradesh Act No. 9/77. This property has not been assigned by the Government of India. This settlement deed is written and given in your name, stating that there are no other heirs or male and female rights holders to this property except me.
Declaration
The land transferred by this deed includes mango, betel, sweet potato, etc. trees and gardens I hereby declare that I do not have any valuable minerals, mines, granite or other valuable stone mines, missionary or fish ponds etc. and I hereby agree to be prosecuted and liable to pay the excise duty if any such factual details are found to have been concealed in this document.

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 125 of 2026, dated 28-Jan-2026, executed by Vittanala Durga in favour of her Husband, Vittanala Durga Konda towards the property admeasuring an extent of 72 Sq.Yds, Located near by house number 3-291, comprised in survey number 443/1, situated in Vissakoderu Village and GramPanchayat, Palakoderu Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at Sub-Registrar Office Atreyapuram , is bounded as follows: North by: 27.00 Ft RCC House of Yagam Sridevi South by: 27.00 Ft site of Seelam Mutyalamma East by: 24.00 Ft Panchayathi Road West by: 24.00 Ft Land of Other's Note: Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per recitals of the deed.

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note : 1. It is to be noted that there is mismatch with the North Boundary between Deed and EC, it is, therefore advisable for F.I. to obtain updated EC as per Deed (or) proceed as per it's internal policy. 2. It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
